title: powers conferred on me by sections 19 and 21 of the Finance (No. 2) Act 1992
heading: 1. These Regulations may be cited as the Road Vehicles (Registration and
text_raw:
1. These Regulations may be cited as the Road Vehicles (Registration and 

Licensing) (Amendment) Regulations 2020.
text_norm: 1 regulation may cited road vehicle (registration licensing) (amendment) regulation 2020

title: powers conferred on me by sections 19 and 21 of the Finance (No. 2) Act 1992
heading: 2. Article 8 of
text_raw:
2. Article 8 of 

the Road Vehicles (Registration and Licensing) 

(Amendment) (No. 2) Regulations 1992 (S.I. No. 409 of 1992) is amended - 

(a) by the substitution of the following sub-article for sub-article 

(2): 

“(2) A trade licence may be used by a person other than the 
motor trader to whom it was issued where the vehicle is being 
used - 

(a) 

in the course of employment by an employee, 
where he or she is authorised by the motor 
trader to use the vehicle, or 

(b) 

for the purpose of test or trial by a prospective 
purchaser with the knowledge and consent of - 

(i) 

the motor trader, or 

(ii) 

an employee who is authorised by the 
motor trader to consent to the test or trial 
of vehicles.”, 

and 

(b) by the insertion of the following sub-article after sub-article (2): 

“(3) In this Article “employee” means a person employed by 
the motor trader to whom the trade licence was issued.”. 

Notice of the making of this Statutory Instrument was published in 
“Iris Oifigiúil” of 9th June, 2020. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 [205] 3 

GIVEN under the Official Seal of the Minister for Transport, 
Tourism and Sport, 
3 June, 2020. 

SHANE ROSS, 

Minister for Transport, Tourism 
and Sport. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 4 [205]

title: powers conferred on me by sections 19 and 21 of the Finance (No. 2) Act 1992
heading: (This note is not part of the Instrument and does not purport to be a legal
text_raw:
EXPLANATORY NOTE 

(This note is not part of the Instrument and does not purport to be a legal 
interpretation.) 

These Regulations provide for trade licence holders to allow prospective 
buyers to test drive vehicles without the requirement for the trade licence 
holder or an employee to also be physically present in the vehicle. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 [205] 5
